channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dodgers force World Series to decisive Game 7 by holding off Blue Jays 3-1
item.description: Yoshinobu Yamamoto beat Toronto for the second time in a week, as the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers held off the Blue Jays 3-1 on Friday nigh...

item.title: Twenty Years Later, Atrocities Haunt Darfur Again
item.description: The world seems unable, or unwilling, to do much to stop a new struggle on an old battlefield, as atrocities sweep villages and towns.

item.title: It’s Halloween Night, and New York Is Decked Out in All Its Gory Glory
item.description: The spooky season comes to end with what is billed as the world’s largest Halloween parade.

item.title: Trump’s Latest White House Makeover: The Lincoln Bathroom in Marble and Gold
item.description: President Trump said the new look was “totally in keeping” with the era of Abraham Lincoln.

item.title: How Britain Got Investors to Line Up for Nuclear Power
item.description: Developers have finally broken ground on the project, known as Sizewell C, but getting there meant navigating wary investors and local opposition.

item.title: As the Shutdown Pain Grows, Trump Attends to Other Matters
item.description: The president attended a Halloween party Friday and called attention to the marble renovation of a White House bathroom.

item.title: Tanzania Racked by Deadly Protests After Election
item.description: The United Nations said at least 10 people had been killed. Opposition leaders claimed the death toll could be in the hundreds, and one official calle...

item.title: He Survived the Invasion. What He Really Wanted Was a Friend.
item.description: During the war, a Ukrainian boy lost his home, his father and his friends. Could he find new buddies at a camp in the mountains?

item.title: Twenty Years Later, Atrocities Haunt Darfur Again
item.description: The world seems unable, or unwilling, to do much to stop a new struggle on an old battlefield, as atrocities sweep villages and towns.

item.title: Federal judges order administration to pay SNAP benefits but what's next remains unclear
item.description: Two federal judges ordered the Trump administration to use emergency funding to provide SNAP benefits. But it's unclear how much, or when, those funds...

item.title: Photos: Food banks scramble to get ready as SNAP funding deadline looms
item.description: Some 42 million people in the U.S. who rely on SNAP benefits could soon join the already long lines at the nation's food banks and pantries that are a...

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to maintain a ceasefire -- for now. Here's what to know
item.description: Relations between the two neighbors hit a low point this month, with fighting killing people on both sides of the border. At issue is a rise in milita...

item.title: What does '67' mean? Dictionary.com's 2025 word of the year has no definition
item.description: "67," pronounced "six seven," spread from a rap song, through sports and social media, to classrooms and homes across the U.S. But even the artist who...

item.title: In One Jamaican Town, Hurricane Melissa Left Behind Floodwaters and Dead Livestock
item.description: The Category 5 storm ravaged western Jamaica and drenched the small community of New River, where residents were coping with a massive clean up. At le...

item.title: Ukraine Gamifies the War: 40 Points to Destroy a Tank, 12 to Kill a Soldier
item.description: Drone teams compete to ascend a scoreboard that rewards units for successful attacks. Ukrainian officials say the contest helps keep soldiers motivate...
